関連科目: Career seminar for International Organizations, Management of International Organizations, Internship in the United Nations
授業方法: The seminar will be conducted face to face on campus in principle.  However, when there are students who cannot physically come to campus due to restrictive measures taken against the pandemic, sessions will be conducted in hybrid manner that combines interactive online schooling.

第1回:
(9/24) Introduction and overview of the course (Miwa)
1) Understanding objectives and structure of the course
2) Exploring your own experiences on human rights
Assignment: Each student prepares one-page report on her/his experiences on human rights.
第2回:
(10/1) UN and human rights (Miwa)
1) UN and human rights
2) UN Charter
3) Universal Declaration of Human Rights (UDHR)
Assignment: Each student prepares one-page report on Universal Declaration of Human Rights.
第3回:
(10/8) Human Rights Council (Miwa)
1) Roles and functions of Human Rights Council
2) Universal Periodic Review (UPR)

Assignment: Each student prepares one-page report on;
(1) UN Human Rights Council, and
(2) Universal Periodic Review (UPR)'s functions.
第4回:
(10/15) Treaty bodies and their functions (Miwa)
1) 9 core human rights treaties and their committees
2) Concluding observations
3) Individual commmunication
Assignment: Each student prepares one-page report on one of the 9 core human rights treaties.
第5回:
(10/22) Mainstreaming human rights at the UN (Miwa)
1) Mainstreaming human rights at the UN: What it means and how we proceed
2) Human-rights based approach to development and programming
Assignment: Each student prepares one-page report on “Mainstreaming of Human Rights at the UN" or “Human Rights Based Approach to Development”.
第6回:
(10/29) UN and disability (Nishino)
1) How disability has been regarded in international settings and the UN.
2) Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities (CRPD)
3) Case study discussion: Students are expected to actively participate in group and class discussions.
第7回: Assignment: Each student prepares one-page report on UNHCR's programme focus.
第8回: (11/12) UNHCR: Applying human rights and humanitarian principles for refugee support (Shimizu)
Assignment: Each student prepares one-page report on challenges in applying human rights & humanitarian principles for refugee support
第10回:
(11/26) Humanitarian principles (Akahoshi)
1) Historical development of humanitarian principles
2) Application of humanitarian principles

Assignment: Each student prepares one-page report on humanitarian principles

Suggested reading:
1) https://www.unocha.org/themes
第11回:
(12/3) A principled approach to humanitarian action (Kukita)
1) UNICEF’s perspective working in complex emergencies
2) Child rights-based approach and humanitarian support to children
3) Core commitment for children
4) Child soldiers
5) UNICEF’s cluster responsibilities
Assignment: Each student prepares one-page report on special considerations in taking humanitarian support to children.
第12回:
(12/10) Guest: Head of UN OCHA Kobe (Kukita)
1) The roles and activities of the United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)
2) OHCA and global humanitarian coordination architecture
Assignment: Each student prepares one-page report on UN OCHA's role in global humanitarian architecture.
第13回:
(12/17) Reflecting the course (Miwa)
1) Reflecting the course
2) Discussion on issues raised
3) Preparing for presentation
Assignment: Each student prepares one-page report on (1) what she/he has learned in the seminar and (2) an outline of final presentation with its title, research question and structure.
第14回:
(1/7) Conclusion (Miwa)
1) Presentations by students on specific human rights and humanitarian issues that they choose
2) Evaluation of the course
Assignment: Each student makes a presentation on a specific theme/topic of human rights or humanitarian issues she/he chooses for the term paper.
